ThingDef.label: ironwood tree
ThingDef.description: Ironwood trees got their name from the legendary strength of the wood.

ThingDef.label: chopped ironwood stump
ThingDef.description: A stump left behind after a ironwood tree has been felled. The stump can be extracted but yields very little usable ironwood. Left outdoors, the stump will deteriorate in time.

ThingDef.label: smashed ironwood stump
ThingDef.description: The remnants of a ironwood tree destroyed by damage. It's ugly. The stump can be extracted but yields very little usable ironwood. Left outdoors, the stump will deteriorate in time.

ThingDef.label: apple tree
ThingDef.description: A fruit bearing tree that grows apples and is not destroyed when picked.

ThingDef.label: banana tree
ThingDef.description: A fruit bearing tree that grows banana and is not destroyed when picked.

ThingDef.label: orange tree
ThingDef.description: A fruit bearing tree that grows oranges and is not destroyed when picked.

ThingDef.label: peach tree
ThingDef.description: A fruit bearing tree that grows peaches and is not destroyed when picked.

ThingDef.label: date palm tree
ThingDef.description: A fruit bearing tree that grows dates and is not destroyed when picked.

ThingDef.label: fig tree
ThingDef.description: A fruit bearing tree that grows figs and is not destroyed when picked.

ThingDef.label: coconut tree
ThingDef.description: A fruit bearing tree that grows coconuts and is not destroyed when picked.

ThingDef.label: cherry tree
ThingDef.description: A fruit bearing tree that grows cherries and is not destroyed when picked.

ThingDef.label: pineapple plant
ThingDef.description: Think skin fruit that grows a top a bush.

ThingDef.label: cloudberry plant
ThingDef.description: A berry bush that grows well in cold climates.

ThingDef.label: gooseberry plant
ThingDef.description: A berry bush that grows well in cold climates.

ThingDef.label: Mushroom
ThingDef.description: This robust mushroom has been genetically engineered and cultivated to produce a filling meat substitute. Found in the wild and grown in hydroponics.

ThingDef.label: bee hive
ThingDef.description: A hive of bees. Harvest them for honey.

ThingDef.label: garden rose
ThingDef.description: A beautiful cultivated flower, the rose has been a symbol of love since Earth's ancient era.

ThingDef.label: garden daylily
ThingDef.description: A cultivated flower with wide petals and a short lifespan. Daylilies are very beautiful, but must be replanted often.

ThingDef.label: Plumeria
ThingDef.description: A beautiful cultivated small bushy flower that grows in random colors.

ThingDef.label: Plumeria
ThingDef.description: A beautiful cultivated small bushy flower that grows in random colors.

ThingDef.label: chokevine
ThingDef.description: Tangled masses of cord-like, spiky vines which coil in great masses along the ground. Chokevine greatky slows down anyone who moves over it. Multiple tribes have independently generated stories of chokevine strangling children to death in the night, as a way to scare kids into coming home before dark.

ThingDef.label: grass
ThingDef.description: Wild grass. Grows anywhere there is a little light and minimally fertile ground.

ThingDef.label: tall grass
ThingDef.description: Wild tall grass. Slows down anyone moving over it.

ThingDef.label: cave grass
ThingDef.description: cave grass. Grows anywhere there is a no light and minimally fertile ground.

ThingDef.label: barley plant
ThingDef.description: A cereal grain. Hearty plant that is imune to blight. Used in cooking and for making ale.

ThingDef.label: pincushion cactus
ThingDef.description: A short cactus. It is so named because it resembles a pincushion.

ThingDef.label: snow beet plant
ThingDef.description: A simple, highly nutritious plants. Grows well even in somewhat poor soil. Harvests quickly. A strong, versatile crop. Does not die in cold weather.

ThingDef.label: red lentil plant
ThingDef.description: A redish variety of the lentil plant. One of the oldest know domesticated plants.

ThingDef.label: bean plant
ThingDef.description: Common bean cooked up in many ways. Will not die due to toxic fallout.

ThingDef.label: olive tree
ThingDef.description: A fruit bearing tree that grows olives and is not destroyed when picked.

ThingDef.label: pineapple plant
ThingDef.description: Think skin fruit that grows a top a bush.

ThingDef.label: cloudberry plant
ThingDef.description: A berry bush that grows well in cold climates.

ThingDef.label: gooseberry plant
ThingDef.description: A berry bush that grows well in cold climates.

ThingDef.label: grape vine
ThingDef.description: A sweet small fruit that grows in small viney bushes.

ThingDef.label: blueberry plant
ThingDef.description: Blue colored berry that grows in bushes.

ThingDef.label: watermelon plant
ThingDef.description: This fruit is rich in vitamins A and C and can be eaten raw or cooked in a variety of ways.

ThingDef.label: garden agave
ThingDef.description: A large-leafed desert plant with edible flowers and stalks.

ThingDef.label: tea plant
ThingDef.description: A green leafy plant, who's leaves can be brewed into a tasty beverage.

ThingDef.label: coffee plant
ThingDef.description: A green, leafy plant yielding coffee beans. These beans can be brewed into a tasty beverage.

ThingDef.label: bamboo plant
ThingDef.description: A fast-growing tree-like species that grows in cluster. Bamboo can be harvested for a wood-like material. The plant itself is not beautiful.

ThingDef.label: cocoa bush
ThingDef.description: A tropical bush that produces chocolate, genetically engineered to sweeten its own product, and survive in slightly less-warm climates. Produces a lot less then the trees.

ThingDef.label: bee tree
ThingDef.description: A genetically engineered birch tree, designed to attract bees to build a hive in.

ThingDef.label: apple tree
ThingDef.description: A fruit bearing tree that grows apples and is not destroyed when picked.

ThingDef.label: banana tree
ThingDef.description: A fruit bearing tree that grows banana and is not destroyed when picked.

ThingDef.label: orange tree
ThingDef.description: A fruit bearing tree that grows oranges and is not destroyed when picked.

ThingDef.label: peach tree
ThingDef.description: A fruit bearing tree that grows peaches and is not destroyed when picked.

ThingDef.label: date palm tree
ThingDef.description: A fruit bearing tree that grows dates and is not destroyed when picked.

ThingDef.label: fig tree
ThingDef.description: A fruit bearing tree that grows figs and is not destroyed when picked.

ThingDef.label: coconut tree
ThingDef.description: A fruit bearing tree that grows coconuts and is not destroyed when picked.

ThingDef.label: cherry tree
ThingDef.description: A fruit bearing tree that grows cherries and is not destroyed when picked.

ThingDef.label: ambrosia bush
ThingDef.description: A bush which yields the ambrosia fruit. Ambrosia is pleasurable to eat and produces a slightly addictive chemical warmth effect. Grown in a Hydroponics basin. Does not destroy when harvested.

ThingDef.label: baby agarilux
ThingDef.description: An purple mushroom. Its size and glowing protrusions make this fungus beautiful to look at. Dies when exposed to light. Faster grow than the kind that grow in nature, but also has a much smaller yield
